detailed_description: The API endpoint has been marked as deprecated but is missing a sunset date, which violates the deprecation policy that requires a minimum time period between deprecation and sunset dates.
mitigation: Either add a sunset date using the x-sunset extension, or run oasdiff without the deprecation-days requirement.

description: Endpoint deprecated with invalid sunset date.
detailed_description: The sunset date is invalid.
mitigation: When specifying sunset dates, use the RFC3339 date format (e.g., '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z') to ensure proper parsing and compatibility.

description: A global security requirement was added.
detailed_description: A global security requirement was added to the API definition. By default, applying a global security requirement means all endpoints inherit the security requirement unless explicitly overridden. Existing clients that previously accessed unsecured endpoints may start receiving 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden responses.

description: A global security requirement was deleted.
detailed_description: A global security requirement was removed from the API definition. Endpoints previously secured globally now become publicly accessible, unless they have local security overrides.

description: A global security scope was added.
detailed_description: A new scope has been added to the global security requirements for OAuth 2.0 or OpenID Connect authentication. As a result, any authenticated request now requires tokens with this additional scope permission. Requests using tokens that lack this scope will be rejected by the server, usually with a 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden response.

description: A global security scope was removed.
detailed_description: A security scope has been removed from the global OAuth 2.0 or OpenID Connect authentication requirements. While clients no longer need to include this scope in their requests, continuing to do so will not cause any issues.
The specified stability level is invalid. The stability level must be one of 'stable', 'beta', 'alpha', or 'deprecated'.
An operation ID was added to an operation in the API definition. The operation ID is a unique identifier for the operation and is used to reference the operation in other parts of the API definition.

The operation ID has been removed from an API operation. This removal may cause issues for clients, particularly those using auto-generated SDKs, that depend on operation IDs to reference specific API operations.

description: A path was removed before the specified sunset date.
detailed_description: The specified path was removed from the API definition before the specified sunset date.
mitigation: Keep the path available in the API specification until reaching the designated sunset date.

description: A path was removed after being deprecated.
detailed_description: The specified path was removed from the API definition after being deprecated.

description: A path was removed without being deprecated.
detailed_description: The specified path was removed from the API definition without being deprecated.
mitigation: Ensure the path is deprecated before removal.

detailed_description: The sunset date is invalid.
mitigation: Use the RFC3339 date format (e.g., '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z') to ensure proper parsing and compatibility.

description: An endpoint was removed before the specified sunset date.
detailed_description: The specified endpoint was removed from the API definition before the specified sunset date.
mitigation: Keep the endpoint available in the API specification until reaching the designated sunset date.

description: An endpoint was removed after being deprecated.
detailed_description: The specified endpoint was removed from the API definition after being deprecated.

description: An endpoint was removed without being deprecated.
detailed_description: The specified endpoint was removed from the API definition without being deprecated.
mitigation: Ensure the endpoint is deprecated before removal.

description: A schema was removed from the components section.
detailed_description: A schema was removed from the API definition. This schema will no longer be available for use in the API.

description: A security requirement was added to the endpoint definition.
detailed_description: A new security requirement has been introduced to this endpoint. As a result, clients who were previously able to access this endpoint without authentication may now receive 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden responses.

The specified sunset date is before the current date. The sunset date must be a date in the future. This change can break clients that rely on the sunset date to plan for the removal of deprecated elements, as they will not have a clear timeline for when the element will be unavailable, leading to potential failures in their applications.
